thread.title: Man Stabs Girlfriend in Head After Following Her Into UWS Building: NYPD
thread.title_full: Man Stabs Girlfriend in Head After Following Her Into UWS Building: NYPD

title: Man Stabs Girlfriend in Head After Following Her Into UWS Building: NYPD
text:
Man Stabs Girlfriend in Head After Following Her Into UWS Building: NYPD By Aidan Gardiner | February 22, 2017 2:52pm Twitter Facebook Email More 
MANHATTAN â€” A man ordered to stay away from his girlfriend followed her into an Upper West Side building, stabbed her in the head and slashed her face Wednesday, police said. 
The 37-year-old attacker, whose name wasn't immediately released, confronted the 45-year-old woman in the elevator of the Columbus Avenue building near West 101st Street at 11 p.m. as she headed up to her friend's apartment on the fifth floor, an NYPD spokeswoman said. 
There, the suspect grabbed her by the throat before punching her, stabbing her and slashing her in the face, hands, body and back, police said. 
He fled the scene after the attack and wasn't immediately arrested, police said. 
The woman was treated at an area hospital, where she's listed in stable condition, police said. 
The suspect   5-foot-7 and weighing about 170 pounds, police said. 
A court had previously issued an order of protection against him on the girlfriend's behalf, police said.
